channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description: @geerlingguy It‚Äôs a service to log (‚Äúscrobble‚Äù) and list the music one plays. That is, if I play a song, the fact that I played a song shows up on my profile. It‚Äôs probably someone who watched your videos using Chrome. There‚Äôs an extension that ‚Äúdetects‚Äù music played on YT and ‚Äúscrobbles‚Äù it.
@theurbangeog I‚Äôm not in that part of town a lot, but when I am, Major CONVENIENCE makes me laugh each time I walk by it.

Non-Binding Tentative Deal Twitter is blowing up tonight!
Non-binding tentative deal.
Non-binding tentative deal.
Non-binding tentative deal.
NON-BINDING.
TENTATIVE DEAL!
The only Twitter that loves non-binding tentative deals more than Politics Twitter is Sports Twitter.
The only Twitter that loves non-binding tentative deals more than Politics Twitter is Sports Twitter.
They meant left-leaning, which is also funny. https://t.co/pVuTyAOvJG
‚ÄúTrudeau will be prime minister until 2025‚Äù which, OK, but do we even know what will happen this year, much less 3 years from now?

If I could do it without having to follow the person, I‚Äôd love to be able to follow single mega-threads.
I‚Äôd follow Chris Messina‚Äôs software updates mega-thread in a heartbeat if I could. https://t.co/Lg5QAdFlZL

@Kimli Oh, that‚Äôs a great amount of time to spend there. I‚Äôm not much of a car driver, but having access to one on my last trip there was essential. Have you heard the it‚Äôs-funny-because-it‚Äôs-true joke that you should be prepared for three types of weather at all times?

@Kimli I‚Äôd love to hear about the trip during and afterwards. I assume you‚Äôll do what I joke are the legally required tourist things, like tour the Golden Circle and go to the Blue Lagoon? Iceland‚Äôs tourist authorities will demand proof you‚Äôve done those things. OK, no they won‚Äôt.

Now that almost all of the COVID-19 restrictions have been lifted in Ontario, never to return, since the pandemic is over, I still only have weak explanations about the strong reactions against them.
The weak explanation I had about the ‚Äústop living in fear, live your life!‚Äù people was that they themselves lacked a fear response to basically anything. But that‚Äôs a brain disorder, and a rare one.
The weak explanation I had about the people who complained that they couldn‚Äôt go to a restaurant or attend a party was that these were ecstatic experiences and that preventing them from having those experiences amounted to torture. But is dining out or partying that awesome?
The weak explanation I had for people who protested against COVID-19 restrictions was that they didn‚Äôt actually believe in anything other than getting on TV. Going viral online was acceptable, with getting on the TV news being the ultimate goal for them. But was it?
I can‚Äôt wait to eat my mask when the prohibition against doing so ends tomorrow. https://t.co/8q3cFJUU7t
@blogTO I‚Äôve been wearing my mask even while alone in my apartment and while sleeping. I can‚Äôt wait for the mandate to wear it at all times to end tomorrow.
@Planta Now that you‚Äôre in your forties and physically located in Vancouver, you‚Äôre allowed to be a guest on the Over 40 in Vancouver podcast! /cc @rtanglao
@Planta Now that you‚Äôre in your forties and physically located in Vancouver, you are allowed to be a guest on the Over 40 in Vancouver podcast! /cc @rtangalo

I‚Äôm marching in the St. Patrick‚Äôs Day Parade today. ‚òòÔ∏è Look for the people dressed up as Vikings! https://t.co/T7xt98C6Xg
I dropped off at Yonge & Bloor. The Club President and her family are doing us proud for the rest of the way.
Marching in a parade is not something I‚Äôd recommend camera shy people do.
Yonge St. seemed a bit bare north of College, otherwise I was heartened by the turnout on Bloor and on Queen. Happy crowds are back again! https://t.co/ybzl2MC6RJ
Every time I walk by @PlantaQueen, I think of Joseph @Planta. https://t.co/dHwE5FU23D

Big day tomorrow. https://t.co/O4gD0Ju2N3
I wonder what bad people are looking forward to doing tomorrow that they couldn‚Äôt do for the last two years.
I went to the grocery store tonight. Not a lot of people there, which is normal just before closing. A noticeable few not wearing a mask, including an employee. No giant sign at the escalator anymore. I thought maybe there‚Äôs be one recommending the wearing of masks, but nope.
It‚Äôs the weekend before mask mandates are lifted in Toronto and I already feel like I‚Äôm in the minority in still wearing a mask in the public areas of my apartment building.
@CamilleRK4 ü§î I‚Äôm pretty sure I have to move to Etobicoke.

@BooksCassidy I only really changed my family name on Twitter (that said, it‚Äôs the name I was born with). It goes back to the one on my ID when I‚Äôm travelling. I use my ‚Äúbowling name‚Äù in other contexts. File this under: If I have to explain it, I‚Äôm probably embarrassed by it.
@BooksCassidy I did that when I moved to Toronto, at least partially.

I don‚Äôt look like anybody in my neighbourhood, don‚Äôt have a dog like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood, don‚Äôt have a partner like seemingly everybody in my neighbourhood. I wonder if any of that‚Äôs true in Etobicoke.
Is it quiet in Etobicoke? It‚Äôs constantly loud in Downtown Toronto.
Has anybody spent a week or a month living in another part of town just to see what it would be like to move to that part of town? Asking for an Etobicoke.

I‚Äôve updated the code that puts a beer emoji in your terminal prompt on Fridays for Zsh, the default shell for MacOS these days. https://t.co/fszt0svAEy
There‚Äôs a burrito emoji now üåØ, but Wednesday is burrito day for me, not Tuesdays anymore, and I put a lemon üçã in my terminal prompt on Wednesdays, so I‚Äôll have to think about that one. ü§î https://t.co/qxpqE5mJy8
It took until Friday morning to be blatantly wrong about something at work, so I consider this a good week.

Oh hey, Howard Schultz is back as CEO of Starbucks. https://t.co/7YT8s8jhh0
I‚Äôve been following news of him ever since I uploaded a photo I took of him in Vancouver to Wikipedia. https://t.co/BiTJYyYIkr
@Planta The Congressional Auditorium, part of the underground U.S. Capitol Visitor Center. https://t.co/x6R4os3J5a

I‚Äôm going to this because, I don‚Äôt know, I just want to feel like I‚Äôm part of something, and the orange-branded party it still the one that most closely aligns with where I stand. https://t.co/5qdb9N7SRq
This, and I can‚Äôt stress this enough, is my aesthetic. https://t.co/Y2BA0rDSOb
